sen.j: 天下（てんか、てんが、てんげ、あめのした）とは、全世界を意味する概念。
sen.e: Tenka (tenga, tenge, amenoshita) is a notion which means the whole world.
Tenka (天下, also pronounced tenga, tenge, or amenoshita) is a notion which means the whole world.
Tenka (天下, also pronounced tenga, tenge, or amenoshita) is a notion which means the whole world.

sen.j: 字義的には「普天の下」という意味で、地理的限定のない空間のことであるが、用法によっては一定の地理概念と同じ意味に用いられることもある。
sen.e: The definition of the word is "futen no ge", which means a space with no geographical limit, but depending on usage, it sometimes means a certain geographical notion.
The definition of the word is "futen no moto," which means a space with no geographical limits, but depending on usage, it sometimes means a certain geographical notion.
sen.cmt: 「普天の下」はfutennomotoと読みます（yahoo辞書より）。
sen.e: The definition of the word is "futen no moto," which means a space with no geographical limits, but depending on usage, it sometimes means a certain geographical notion.

sen.j: また一般に天下は、一定の秩序原理を伴い、その対象とされる地域・民衆・国家という形で捉えられる。
sen.e: Generally speaking, Tenka is accompanied by a fixed principle of order and it means an area, people or a nation which is subject to such principle of order.
Generally speaking, Tenka is accompanied by a fixed principle of order and it means an area, people or a nation which is subject to such a principle of order.
Generally speaking, Tenka is accompanied by a fixed principle of order and it means an area, people or a nation which is subject to such a principle of order.

sen.j: すなわち一般に「世界」は「世界観」がなくても客観的に存在しているものと認識されるが、「天下」は一定の秩序原理によって観念的に成立している。
sen.e: In other words, while the existence of "sekai" (the world) is recognized objectively even without "a view of the world", "Tenka" exists ideologically based on the fixed principle of order.
In other words, while the existence of "sekai" (the world) is recognized objectively even without "a view of the world," "Tenka" exists ideologically based on the fixed principle of order.

sen.e: "Tenka" is the Han pronunciation of Chinese characters, "Tenga" is its rendaku and "Tenge" is the Wu pronunciation.
"Tenka" is the Han pronunciation of Chinese characters, "Tenga" is the pronunciation with rendaku (the euphonic change of unvoiced to voiced sound) and "Tenge" is the Wu pronunciation.

sen.e: It is usually pronounced "Tenka" at present, but originally it was pronounced "Tenge".

sen.j: 中国

China
China

sen.j: 中国における天下は、一般に中国王朝の皇帝が主宰し、一定の普遍的な秩序原理に支配されている空間であった。
sen.e: In China, Tenka generally referred to the space which the emperor of Chinese dynasty ruled based on the fixed universal principle of order.
In China, Tenka generally referred to the space which the emperor of the Chinese dynasty ruled based on the fixed universal principle of order.
In China, Tenka generally referred to the space which the emperor of the Chinese dynasty ruled based on the fixed universal principle of order.

sen.j: 天下の中心にあるのが中国王朝の直接支配する地域で、「夏」「華」「中夏」「中華」「中国」などと呼ばれる。
sen.e: What existed in the center of Tenka was the area which the Chinese dynasty directly ruled, and it was called "Ka", "Ka", "Chuka", "Chuka", or "Chugoku" etc.

sen.e: However, these areas were deemed as the ones that were to be incorporated into the principle of order of the emperor of Chinese dynasty.

sen.j: 日本
sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

sen.j: 日本における天下の概念は、はやく古墳時代に見ることができる。
sen.e: In Japan, the notion of Tenka was seen as early as in Kofun period (tumulus period).
In Japan, the notion of Tenka was seen as early as in the Kofun (tumulus) period.
In Japan, the notion of Tenka was seen as early as in the Kofun (tumulus) period.

sen.j: 当時、倭国王は中国王朝に対して倭国王または倭王と称していた。
sen.e: At that time, Kings of Wa called themselves Wakakuo or Wao to the Chinese dynasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At that time, Kings of Wa called themselves Wakakuo (the King of the nation of Wa) or Wao (the King of Wa) to the Chinese dynasty.
At that time, Kings of Wa called themselves Wakakuo (the King of the nation of Wa) or Wao (the King of Wa) to the Chinese dynasty.

sen.j: しかし、熊本県の江田船山古墳から出土した鉄剣・鉄刀銘文などによれば5世紀後期ごろには国内に対して「ヤマト大王」（アメノシタシロシメスオホキミ）と称していたことが判明している。
sen.e: According to iron swords/inscriptions on iron swords which were excavated at the Eta Funayama Tumulus in Kumamoto Prefecture, however, they used the title of "Yamato Daio" (amenoshita shiroshimesu okimi) inside Japan around in the late fifth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the iron swords and inscriptions on the swords which were excavated at the Eta Funayama Tumulus in Kumamoto Prefecture, however, they used the title of "Yamato Okimi" (amenoshita shiroshimesu okimi) (literally, the Grate King of Yamato) inside Japan around in the late fifth century.

According to the iron swords and inscriptions on the swords which were excavated at the Eta Funayama Tumulus in Kumamoto Prefecture, however, they used the title of "Yamato Okimi" (amenoshita shiroshimesu okimi) (literally, the Grate King of Yamato) inside Japan around in the late fifth century.

sen.j: これは、その時期までに、倭国内で「中国世界とは異なる独自の天下」概念が発生していた徴証だと考えられている。
sen.e: The above is thought as the evidence that the notion of "own Tenka which is different from that of China" had already been born by that time.
The above is thought as the evidence that the notion of "own Tenka which is different from that of China" had already been born by that time.
The above is thought as the evidence that the notion of "own Tenka which is different from that of China" had already been born by that time.

sen.j: 『隋書』によれば7世紀初頭の大業3年（607年）に倭国王（原文「俀國王」）が隋皇帝煬帝への親書に自らを「日出處天子」と称したことも、中国世界と異なる天下概念が存続していたことを物語っている。
sen.e: According to Suishu (the Book of the Sui Dynasty), Wakokuo called himself "Hiizurutokoro no tenshi" in the letter which he sent to Emperor Yodai in 607, and this fact also suggests the existence of the different notion of Tenka from Chinese world.

According to Suishu (the Book of the Sui Dynasty), the King of Wa called himself "Hiizurutokoro no tenshi" (literally, the king of the place where the sun rises) in the letter he sent to Emperor Yodai in 607, and this fact also suggests the existence of the different notion of Tenka from the Chinese world.
sen.cmt: 日出處天子の意味を補いました。
sen.e: According to Suishu (the Book of the Sui Dynasty), the King of Wa called himself "Hiizurutokoro no tenshi" (literally, the king of the place where the sun rises) in the letter he sent to Emperor Yodai in 607, and this fact also suggests the existence of the different notion of Tenka from the Chinese world.

sen.j: 7世紀には律令制の導入とともに中国的な天下概念が移入された。
sen.e: The Chinese style notion of Tenka was introduced in the seventh century in association with the establishment of the Ritsuryo system.
The notion of Tenka in the Chinese style was introduced in the seventh century in association with the establishment of the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: 若干表現を変えました。
sen.e: The notion of Tenka in the Chinese style was introduced in the seventh century in association with the establishment of the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 律令制の特徴である公民思想を伴って、「天下公民」という形で把握された。
sen.e: Along with komin shiso (philosophy of public citizen), which was the characteristics of Ritsuryo system, it was understood as "Tenka komin" (Tenka citizen).
Along with the philosophy of regarding people as public citizens, which was the characteristics of the Ritsuryo system, it was understood as "Tenka komin" (Tenka citizens).
sen.cmt: 説明を補足し、文法を修正しました。公民思想をthe philosophy of regarding people as public citizensとしました。
sen.e: Along with the philosophy of regarding people as public citizens, which was the characteristics of the Ritsuryo system, it was understood as "Tenka komin" (Tenka citizens).

sen.j: 王朝国家の進展に伴って、平安時代には一時「天下」の概念は廃れるが、鎌倉幕府の成立が「天下の草創」と認識されたように、武家社会の進展に伴って日本とほぼ同義の意味で使用されるようになった。
sen.e: Although the notion of "Tenka" once became out of use in the Heian period according the development of the dynasty state, it again came to be in use according to the development of samurai society as the word which had the same meaning with Japan, as shown by the fact that the establishment of Kamakura bakufu was understood as "the creation of Tenka".

Although the notion of "Tenka" once became out of use in the Heian period according to the development of the dynastic state, it again started to be used according to the development of samurai society as the word which was almost synonymous with "Japan," as shown by the fact that the establishment of the Kamakura bakufu was understood as "the creation of Tenka."
sen.cmt: 不要な半角スペースを除きました。王朝国家の訳にdynastic stateを用いました。
sen.e: Although the notion of "Tenka" once became out of use in the Heian period according to the development of the dynastic state, it again started to be used according to the development of samurai society as the word which was almost synonymous with "Japan," as shown by the fact that the establishment of the Kamakura bakufu was understood as "the creation of Tenka."

sen.j: （天皇、律令制、天下統一参照）

sen.j: 朝鮮
sen.e: Korea
Korea
Korea

sen.j: 朝鮮半島においては、歴史的に「天下」の用例は極めて少ない。
sen.e: On the Korean Peninsula, the term "Tenka" was seldom used historically.
On the Korean Peninsula, the term "Tenka" was seldom used historically.

sen.j: それは中国王朝を中心とする天下のなかにあった時期が極めて長かったことによる。
sen.e: The reason for the above is because Korea was included in the Tenka of Chinese dynasty for quite long time.
The reason for the above is because Korea was included in the Tenka of the Chinese dynasty for a quite long time.
The reason for the above is because Korea was included in the Tenka of the Chinese dynasty for a quite long time.

sen.j: 高句麗・新羅・百済の古代王朝、そして高麗の時代にも朝鮮を中心とする独自の天下概念がなかったわけではないが、高麗後期に朱子学が流入すると、名分論の立場から朝鮮中心の天下的世界認識に批判が加えられた。
sen.e: There was the notion of Tenka with Korea in the center in the period of old dynasties like Goguryeo/ Silla/Baekje as well as in the Goryeo period, but the notion of Tenka with Korea in the center was criticized, from the standpoint of meibunron (theory of justification), when Neo-Confucianism was introduced in the late Goryeo period.

There was the notion of the Korea-centered Tenka in the period of old dynasties like Goguryeo, Silla, and Baekje as well as in the Goryeo period, but the notion was criticized from the standpoint of meibunron (the theory of justification of titles and social standings) when Neo-Confucianism was introduced in the late Goryeo period.
sen.cmt: /を除き、名文論の説明を補足しました（名分論:中国哲学で、名称と分限の一致を求める伝統的思想のこと、デジタル大辞泉より）。
sen.e: There was the notion of the Korea-centered Tenka in the period of old dynasties like Goguryeo, Silla, and Baekje as well as in the Goryeo period, but the notion was criticized from the standpoint of meibunron (the theory of justification of titles and social standings) when Neo-Confucianism was introduced in the late Goryeo period.

sen.j: 一方で朱子学は自国を「小中華」「小華」などと認識する小中華思想を生んだ。
sen.e: Neo-Confucianism created the sho-chuka shiso (literally, mini-Sinocentrism) under which Korea was understood as "sho-chuka" (mini-China) or "sho-ka" (mini-China).
Neo-Confucianism created the sho-chuka shiso (literally, mini-Sinocentrism) under which Korea was understood as "sho-chuka" (mini-China) or "sho-ka" (mini-China).
Neo-Confucianism created the sho-chuka shiso (literally, mini-Sinocentrism) under which Korea was understood as "sho-chuka" (mini-China) or "sho-ka" (mini-China).

sen.j: 小中華主義は明代中国に流行しながら朝鮮では流行しなかった陽明学を異端視する風潮、清朝による中国支配を「中国が夷狄の支配に服するもの」と規定する認識となり、朝鮮こそが中華の本流であるという思想をはぐくんだ。
sen.e: The philosophy of sho-chuka became the trend to regard Yomei-gaku (neo-Confucianism based on the teachings of Wang Yangming), which was popular in China of Ming dynasty era but was not so in Korea, as heresy, as well as the cognition to define the Qing dynasty's ruling of China as "China is subject to the rule of iteki (barbarians)", and it promoted the idea that Korea is the mainstream of chuka (China).

The philosophy of sho-chuka brought the trend to regard Yomei-gaku (Neo-Confucianism based on the teachings of Wang Yangming), which was popular in China in the Ming dynasty but was not so in Korea, as a heresy, as well as the cognition to define China ruled under the Qing dynasty as "China subjugated by iteki (barbarians)," and accordingly it promoted the idea that Korea is the mainstream of chuka (China).
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、分かりやすくなるよう表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: The philosophy of sho-chuka brought the trend to regard Yomei-gaku (Neo-Confucianism based on the teachings of Wang Yangming), which was popular in China in the Ming dynasty but was not so in Korea, as a heresy, as well as the cognition to define China ruled under the Qing dynasty as "China subjugated by iteki (barbarians)," and accordingly it promoted the idea that Korea is the mainstream of chuka (China).

sen.j: 朝鮮では中国を中心とする「天下」概念と朝鮮を中心とする「天下」概念が並存していた。
sen.e: The notion of "Tenka" centered on China and the notion of "Tenka" centered on Korea co-existed In Korea.
The notions of China-centered "Tenka" and Korea-centered "Tenka" co-existed in Korea.
sen.cmt: 簡潔にするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: The notions of China-centered "Tenka" and Korea-centered "Tenka" co-existed in Korea.

sen.j: ヴェトナム
sen.e: Vietnam
Vietnam
Vietnam

sen.j: ベトナムにおける天下の概念は、13世紀の元寇を契機として民族意識が昂揚するとともに出現した。
sen.e: In Vietnam, the notion of Tenka appeared in the 13th century when the ethnic consciousness was whipped up by the Mongol invasion.
In Vietnam, the notion of Tenka appeared in the 13th century when the ethnic consciousness was whipped up by the Mongol invasion.
In Vietnam, the notion of Tenka appeared in the 13th century when the ethnic consciousness was whipped up by the Mongol invasion.

sen.j: その天下概念は当初陳朝にいたるヴェトナム王朝を南越国の後継と位置づけ、その領域であった中国の嶺南地方からヴェトナム北部に至る地域に固有の天下概念を設定するものであった。
sen.e: The above notion of Tenka defined the Vietnam dynasty, which started from Tran dynasty, as the successor of Nanetsu-koku and deemed its former territry, the region from the Reinan region of China to the northern part of Vietnam, as its own Tenka.

The above notion of Tenka defined the Vietnam dynasty, which started from the Tran dynasty, as the successor of Nanetsukoku (南越国) (the Kingdom of Nanyue) and deemed its original territory from the Lingnan area of China to the northern part of Vietnam as its own Tenka.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正し、南越国の意味を補足しました。後の文で漢字表記について述べているので南越国の漢字表記を残しました。「嶺南」はLingnanだと思います。
sen.e: The above notion of Tenka defined the Vietnam dynasty, which started from the Tran dynasty, as the successor of Nanetsukoku (南越国) (the Kingdom of Nanyue) and deemed its original territory from the Lingnan area of China to the northern part of Vietnam as its own Tenka.

sen.j: ところが18世紀末の黎朝末期のころになると、南越をヴェトナム王朝の正統とする史観に批判が加えられた。
sen.e: Around the end of 18th century, the end of Lê Dynasty, the historical view that regards Nanetsu as the orthodoxy of Vietnam dynasty was criticized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, around the end of 18th century in the end of the Lê Dynasty, the historical view that regarded Lingnan as orthodox territory of the Vietnam dynasty came to be criticized.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、若干言葉を補いました。
sen.e: However, around the end of 18th century in the end of the Lê Dynasty, the historical view that regarded Lingnan as orthodox territory of the Vietnam dynasty came to be criticized.

sen.j: 阮朝の時代には自称国号も「大南」となり「越」字が消滅する。
sen.e: In the Nguyễn Dynasty era, the letter of etsu (越) was deleted from the official name of the country and it became "Dainan"(大南).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Nguyễn Dynasty, the country was renamed "Đại Nam (大南)" and the letter of etsu (越) was deleted from its official name.
sen.cmt: 大南を"Đại Nam"としました。
sen.e: During the Nguyễn Dynasty, the country was renamed "Đại Nam (大南)" and the letter of etsu (越) was deleted from its official name.

sen.j: このことは当時のヨーロッパ人が「トンキン」「コーチシナ」と呼んだ今日のヴェトナムの領域に天下国家が設定されるようになったと考えられている。
sen.e: Based on the above, it is thought that Tenka kokka (tenka and state) was defined as the territory of present Vietnam, which Europeans called "Tonking" or "Kochishina" at the time.
Based on the above, it is thought that tenkakokka (Tenka and the state) was defined as the territory of present Vietnam, which Europeans referred to "Tonkin" or "Cochinchine" at the time.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: Based on the above, it is thought that tenkakokka (Tenka and the state) was defined as the territory of present Vietnam, which Europeans referred to "Tonkin" or "Cochinchine" at the time.

sen.j: ヴェトナムの「天下」は主に中越関係に影響されながら、その領域を変容させた。
sen.e: The territory of Vietnam's "Tenka" changed under the influence of Sino-Vietnam relations.

sen.j: 北方アジアの遊牧民
sen.e: Nomads in the Northern Asia
Nomads in the Northern Asia
Nomads in the Northern Asia

sen.j: モンゴルを代表とする北アジア・中央アジアの遊牧民においては、中国王朝の「天」に対応あるいは類似する概念として「テングリ」概念が存在する。
sen.e: Among the nomads in North Asia/Central Asia represented by those in Mongolia, the notion called "Tenguri" existed as the comparable or similar notion to "Ten" (the heaven) of Chinese dynasty.

Among the nomads in North Asia and Central Asia represented by those in Mongolia, the notion called "Tenguri" exists as the comparable or similar notion to "Ten" (the sky or heaven) of Chinese dynasties.
sen.cmt: /を外し、文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Among the nomads in North Asia and Central Asia represented by those in Mongolia, the notion called "Tenguri" exists as the comparable or similar notion to "Ten" (the sky or heaven) of Chinese dynasties.

sen.j: テングリは今日においてはカムチャツカ半島からマルマラ海にまで遊牧民族の信仰生活に密接にかかわっている。
sen.e: At present, Tenguri is closely related to the religious life of nomads of Kamchatka peninsula to the Sea of Marmara.
At present, Tenguri is closely related to the religious life of nomads of the Kamchatka peninsula to the Sea of Marmara.
At present, Tenguri is closely related to the religious life of nomads of the Kamchatka peninsula to the Sea of Marmara.

sen.j: テングリは天の主宰神として運命神であるとともに、天そのものでもあり、創造神として現れることもある。
sen.e: Tenguri is believed to be the god of destiny or Ten itself since it is the presiding god of Ten, and it somtimes appear as the god of creation.
Tenguri is believed to be the god of destiny or Ten itself since it is the presiding god of Ten, and it sometimes appears as the god of creation.
sen.cmt: スペルミス、文法ミスを修正しました。
sen.e: Tenguri is believed to be the god of destiny or Ten itself since it is the presiding god of Ten, and it sometimes appears as the god of creation.

sen.j: また今日ではテングリに対する祭祀はシャーマニズムに基づいて行われるが、アジアの遊牧民のシャーマニズムには宇宙三界観と呼ばれる独特の世界観があるとされている。
sen.e: Religious services for Tenguri are conducted based on the Shamanism at present, and it is believed that the Shamanism of Asian nomads has its unique view of the world called "Uchu Sangaikan".

Religious services for Tenguri are conducted based on Shamanism at present, and it is believed that the Shamanism of Asian nomads has its unique view of the world called "Uchu Sangaikan" (literally, the view of three realms of the universe).
sen.cmt: 宇宙三界観の説明を補足しました。
sen.e: Religious services for Tenguri are conducted based on Shamanism at present, and it is believed that the Shamanism of Asian nomads has its unique view of the world called "Uchu Sangaikan" (literally, the view of three realms of the universe).

sen.j: 地上にはテングリの代理者として救世主的な英雄がしばしば遣わされ、この英雄は「テングリの子」というように呼ばれていた。
sen.e: A hero, or a savior, was sometimes dispatched to the earth as the proxy of Tenguri, and this hero was called "the son of Tenguri".
In their view, a hero, or a savior, was sometimes dispatched to the earth as the proxy of Tenguri, and this hero was called "the son of Tenguri."
In their view, a hero, or a savior, was sometimes dispatched to the earth as the proxy of Tenguri, and this hero was called "the son of Tenguri."

sen.j: 匈奴の単于やチンギス・カンをはじめとするモンゴル帝国のハーンはこの「テングリの子」を称した。
sen.e: Zenu (king) of Xiongnu as well as the khan of the Mongolian Empire such as Genghis Khan called themselves "the son of Tenguri".
The chanyu (the nomadic supreme rulers) of Xiongnu and the khan of the Mongolian Empire such as Genghis Khan called themselves "the son of Tenguri."
sen.cmt: 「単于」をchanyuとし、説明を補いました。
sen.e: The chanyu (the nomadic supreme rulers) of Xiongnu and the khan of the Mongolian Empire such as Genghis Khan called themselves "the son of Tenguri."

sen.j: 彼らはこのことにより地上の救済を観念上独占し、地上における唯一の君主として君臨する者と主観された。
sen.e: Based on the above, they monopolized the idea of aid on the earth and considered themselves as the sole monarch on the earth.
By doing so, they monopolized the idea of salvation on the earth to be recognized as the sole monarch on the earth.
By doing so, they monopolized the idea of salvation on the earth to be recognized as the sole monarch on the earth.

sen.j: このようにアジアの遊牧民にも一定の秩序原理に基づいた「天下」概念類似の地上世界観が存在したとされる。
sen.e: Among the nomads in Asia, as shown by the above, there was a view of the world based on the fixed pripnciple of order which was similar to the notion of "Tenka".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As shown by the above, the nomads in Asia also had a view of the world based on the fixed principle of order, which was similar to the notion of "Tenka."
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: As shown by the above, the nomads in Asia also had a view of the world based on the fixed principle of order, which was similar to the notion of "Tenka."

sen.j: しかし、そこには「テングリの子」に服属する者と敵対する者という二元的構造が存在するのみで、華夷秩序のように段階的な秩序構造は存在しなかったか希薄であった。
sen.e: However, although the dual structure under which people who obey "the son of Tenguri" and those who confront with him existed, the stepwise structure of order, such as the order of kai (Chinese vs. barbarians), didn't exist or was hardly seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in their notion there existed only the dual structure consisting of those who obeyed "the son of Tenguri" and those who confronted him, and the stepwise structure of order, such as the order of kai (the Chinese vs. barbarians) did not exist or was hardly seen.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくするため表現を変え、文法を少し直しました。縮約の使用を避けました。
sen.e: However, in their notion there existed only the dual structure consisting of those who obeyed "the son of Tenguri" and those who confronted him, and the stepwise structure of order, such as the order of kai (the Chinese vs. barbarians) did not exist or was hardly seen.

sen.j: 中国における「天下」
sen.e: "Tenka" in China

sen.j: 殷の時代には世界としての「天下」はいまだ成立していなかったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that "Tenka" was not established as the world in the Yin dynasty era.
It is thought that "Tenka" was not established as the world in the Yin dynasty era.

sen.j: 周の時代に人格的な天の概念が成立すると、それにあわせて「天下」概念の萌芽が見られる。
sen.e: When the personified notion of Ten was created in the Zhou dynasty era, germinations of the notion of "Tenka" came to be seen.
When the personified notion of Ten was created in the Zhou dynasty era, germination of the notion of "Tenka" came to be seen.

sen.j: 「四方」「万邦」という用語がそれである。
sen.e: They were the terms of "shiho" and "banpo".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The terms of "shiho" and "banpo" are the indications of it.
sen.cmt: Theyがさしている語が分かりづらいので、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The terms of "shiho" and "banpo" are the indications of it.

sen.j: 「四方」というのは王朝成立の対象領域で、その経営の中心は周王のいる中国であり、その周囲にある異民族のいる土地のことである。
sen.e: "Shiho" referred to the territory of the dynasty including China, its center where the emperor of Zhou resided, and the surrounding regions where different ethnic groups lived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Shiho" referred to the territory of the dynasty including China, its center where the emperor of Zhou resided, and the surrounding regions where different ethnic groups lived.
"Shiho" referred to the territory of the dynasty including China, its center where the emperor of Zhou resided, and the surrounding regions where different ethnic groups lived.

sen.j: 「万邦」というのは「民」と「疆土」のことで、「民」は異民族も含めた民、疆土にも異民族の土地が含まれていた。
sen.e: "Banpo" referred to "tami" (people) and "kyodo" (land), and "tami" included the people of different ethnic groups and "kyodo" included the land of different ethnic groups.
"Banpo" referred to "tami" (the people) and "kyodo" (territory), and "tami" included the people of different ethnic groups and "kyodo" included the land of different ethnic groups.
sen.cmt: 民をthe people、境土をterritoryとした方が、より意味が近くなると思いました。
sen.e: "Banpo" referred to "tami" (the people) and "kyodo" (territory), and "tami" included the people of different ethnic groups and "kyodo" included the land of different ethnic groups.

sen.j: 周王は天命によりこの「万邦」を「受け」たとされた。
sen.e: It was believed that the Emperor of Zhou was "given" this "banpo" by tenmei (the order of ten).
It was believed that the Emperor of Zhou was "given" this "banpo" by tenmei (the order of ten).
It was believed that the Emperor of Zhou was "given" this "banpo" by tenmei (the order of ten).

sen.j: 周の後期（春秋時代・戦国時代 (中国)）には、周に封建制されていた諸侯が各自の国内・周辺地域に対する政治支配と同化を進めた。
sen.e: During the last stage of Zhou (the Chunqiu period, Warring States period (China)), lords of various places who had been ruled by Zhou began to administer independently their own territory/surrounding regions.

During the last stage of Zhou (the Chunqiu period and the Warring States period [China]), lords of various places which had been ruled by Zhou began to administer independently and assimilated into their own territory and surrounding regions.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、「同化」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: During the last stage of Zhou (the Chunqiu period and the Warring States period [China]), lords of various places which had been ruled by Zhou began to administer independently and assimilated into their own territory and surrounding regions.

sen.j: また異民族自体が周に封建され、諸侯として大国化する例も見られた。
sen.e: Also, the cases were seen where different ethnic groups were incorporated into Zhou and became major provinces.
Also, some different ethnic groups were incorporated into Zhou and became major provinces.
Also, some different ethnic groups were incorporated into Zhou and became major provinces.

sen.j: これにより多くの国に共通の文化圏、経済圏が形成され、黄河中流域を中心に「中国」概念も拡大された。
sen.e: Thanks to the above, a common cultural sphere/economic sphere was established in many provinces, and the notion of "China" was expanded in the area located along the middle reaches of Yellow River.

Because of these movements, a common cultural or economic sphere was established in many provinces, and the notion of "China" became widespread in the area located along the middle reaches of the Yellow River.
sen.cmt: /を除き、文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Because of these movements, a common cultural or economic sphere was established in many provinces, and the notion of "China" became widespread in the area located along the middle reaches of the Yellow River.

sen.j: 『春秋左氏伝』『国語 (歴史書)』などには「天下」の用法が確認される。
sen.e: The usage of "Tenka" is seen in "Chunqiu Zuoshi Zhuan" (Master Zuo's Commentary to the Spring and Autumns) and "Kokugo" (history book) etc.
The usage of "Tenka" is seen in "Chunqiu Zuoshi Zhuan" (Master Zuo's Commentary to the Spring and Autumns) and "Kokugo" (history book) etc.
The usage of "Tenka" is seen in "Chunqiu Zuoshi Zhuan" (Master Zuo's Commentary to the Spring and Autumns) and "Kokugo" (history book) etc.

sen.j: 秦によって、周の支配していた地域が政治的に一元化されて統合されると、現実の政治世界に対応する明確な地理概念として「天下」概念は顕在化した。
sen.e: When the regions which had been ruled by Zhou was politically unified by Qin dynasty, the notion of "Tenka" became the clear geographical notion which corresponded to the reality in politics.
When the regions which had been ruled by Zhou were politically unified by the Qin dynasty, the notion of "Tenka" became a clear geographical notion which corresponded to the reality in politics.
When the regions which had been ruled by Zhou were politically unified by the Qin dynasty, the notion of "Tenka" became a clear geographical notion which corresponded to the reality in politics.

sen.j: 秦の統一は「天下の統一」であり、中国が天下を統一したということは中国の拡大であった。
sen.e: The unification by Qin was the "unification of Tenka", and the fact that China unified Tenka meant the expansion of China.
The unification by Qin was the "unification of Tenka," and the fact that China unified Tenka meant the expansion of China.
The unification by Qin was the "unification of Tenka," and the fact that China unified Tenka meant the expansion of China.

sen.j: 漢代になると、この「中国＝天下」概念が現実の冊封関係に影響されて変容し、周辺諸民族をも含めた現代的意味での世界として「天下」概念が成立した。
sen.e: During the Han dynasty era, this notion of "China = Tenka" changed under the influence of real sakuho relations, and the contemporary notion of "Tenka", which means the world and includes other ethnic groups, was established.

During the Han dynasty era, this notion of "China = Tenka" changed under the influence of actual sakuho relations, and the contemporary notion of "Tenka," which means the world including other surrounding ethnic groups, was established.

During the Han dynasty era, this notion of "China = Tenka" changed under the influence of actual sakuho relations, and the contemporary notion of "Tenka," which means the world including other surrounding ethnic groups, was established.

sen.j: 冊封関係とは、周辺国家の首長を皇帝の臣下として君臣関係を取り結ぶもので、このことにより周辺国家の首長の支配下にある地域は、観念的に皇帝の主宰する秩序原理に組み入れられた。
sen.e: Sakuho relations means the lord-vassal relations between the emperor and the heads of neighboring states, and by making such relations, the regions under the rule of the heads of neighboring states were ideologically incorporated into the principle of order of the emperor.

Sakuho relations means the lord-vassal relations between the emperor of China and the heads of neighboring states, and by making such relations, the regions under the rule of the heads of those states were ideologically incorporated into the principle of order of the Chinese emperor.
sen.cmt: 言葉を少し補いました。
sen.e: Sakuho relations means the lord-vassal relations between the emperor of China and the heads of neighboring states, and by making such relations, the regions under the rule of the heads of those states were ideologically incorporated into the principle of order of the Chinese emperor.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (中国)には一時中華の内部に複数の皇帝が出現し、天下の政治的分裂という現象が見られた。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (China), plural number of emperors appeared in China and the phenomenon of political division of Tenka was seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (China), a plural number of emperors appeared in China and the phenomenon of political division of Tenka was seen.
During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (China), a plural number of emperors appeared in China and the phenomenon of political division of Tenka was seen.

sen.j: 唐の時代には中華帝国の皇帝は北方遊牧民族の諸国に対しても「大可汗」として君臨した。
sen.e: In the Tang dynasty era, the emperor of Chinese Empire ruled the states of northern nomads as "Great kakhan".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Tang dynasty era, the emperor of the Chinese Empire ruled the states of northern nomads as "Great kakhan."
sen.cmt: Periodの位置を変えました。「大可汗」がGreat kakhanで良いかが確認できませんでした。Great Khanではないかとも思います。
sen.e: In the Tang dynasty era, the emperor of the Chinese Empire ruled the states of northern nomads as "Great Khan."
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントどおりGreat kakhan→Great Khanに修正しました。

sen.j: タラス河畔の戦いに代表されるように、西方で匹敵するイスラーム帝国と軍事的衝突や交易など交渉があったが、唐朝はかつての秦漢帝国と異なり、その天下概念には匈奴のような対等国は基本的には存在しなかった。
sen.e: Although it had a military clash with Islamic empire at the west front, such as the Battle of Talas, Tang dynasty, unlike Qin-Han empire, didn't include the nations of equal footing, such as Xiongnu, in the notion of Tenka.

Although the Tang dynasty had military clashes with the Islamic empire (Caliphate) at the west front such as the Battle of Talas or negotiations including trade, its notion of Tenka, unlike that of the Qin and Han empires, did not include the nations which stood on an equal footing with it, such as Xiongnu.
sen.cmt: 「交易など交渉」を補い、縮約の使用を避けました。
sen.e: Although the Tang dynasty had military clashes with the Islamic empire (Caliphate) at the west front such as the Battle of Talas or negotiations including trade, its notion of Tenka, unlike that of the Qin and Han empires, did not include the nations which stood on an equal footing with it, such as Xiongnu.

sen.j: ところが北宋の時代には、北方に遼・金 (王朝)の強大な王朝が出現した。
sen.e: In the Northern Sung dynasty era, strong dynasties like Liao and Jin (dynasty) appeared in the northern region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the Northern Sung dynasty era, strong dynasties like Liao and Jin appeared in the northern region.
However, in the Northern Sung dynasty era, strong dynasties like Liao and Jin appeared in the northern region.

sen.j: 宋は圧迫されて北方の帝国と国家同士の擬制的な血縁関係（たとえば宋を兄、遼を弟とするような外交関係）を結んだ。
sen.e: Under the pressure of these dynasties, Sung dynasty made a fictitious blood-relation (for example, foreign relations assuming Sun as the older brother and Liao as the younger brother) with these strong dynasties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Under the pressure of these dynasties, the Sung dynasty made a fictitious blood relationship (for example, diplomatic relations assuming Sun as the older brother and Liao as the younger brother) with them.
sen.cmt: 単語を少し変えました。
sen.e: Under the pressure of these dynasties, the Sung dynasty made a fictitious blood relationship (for example, diplomatic relations assuming Sun as the older brother and Liao as the younger brother) with them.

sen.j: この時代の高麗なども両王朝に両属する形を取り、天下は全く二分されていた。
sen.e: As shown by the fact that Goryeo subjected to two dynasties at that time, Tenka was completely divided into two.
As shown by the fact that Goryeo was subject to both dynasties at that time, Tenka was completely divided into two.
As shown by the fact that Goryeo was subject to both dynasties at that time, Tenka was completely divided into two.

sen.j: 空前絶後の支配領域をもったモンゴル帝国、元 (王朝)は再び中国を統一したが、その統治においても、政治上南人（元南宋の民、江南の人士）と漢人（元金の民、華北の人士）は区別されていた。
sen.e: Yuan (Dynasty), the Mongolian Empire which held the vast territory of all time, reunified China, but it made a distinction between nanjin (people of former Southern Sung, people of Konan) and kanjin (people of former Jing, people of Kahoku) in its ruling.

The Yuan dynasty, the Mongolian Empire which held the vast territory of all time, reunified China, but it made a distinction between nanjin (people of former Southern Sung, namely people of the Konan area) and kanjin (people of former Jing, namely people of the Kahoku area) in its ruling.
sen.cmt: 言葉を少し補いました。
sen.e: The Yuan dynasty, the Mongolian Empire which held the vast territory of all time, reunified China, but it made a distinction between nanjin (people of former Southern Sung, namely people of the Konan area) and kanjin (people of former Jing, namely people of the Kahoku area) in its ruling.

sen.j: このことは天下の政治的分裂が元の統治下において解消されなかったことを示している。
sen.e: The above shows the fact that the political division of Tenka was not resolved even under the rule of Yuan.
The above shows the fact that the political division of Tenka was not resolved even under the rule of Yuan.
The above shows the fact that the political division of Tenka was not resolved even under the rule of Yuan.

sen.j: その後明王朝は秦漢帝国の理念に近い形で「中国」を統合するが、その天下はほぼ明王朝の支配領域と同義であり、世界大の広がりを持ったものではなかった。
sen.e: Thereafter Ming dynasty unified "China" in the form akin to the idea of Qin-Han empire, but its Tenka was the synonym of the territory of Ming dynasty and didn't have the world-wide extent.

Thereafter, the Ming dynasty unified "China" in the form akin to the idea of the Qin-Han empire, but its Tenka was the synonym of the territory of the Ming dynasty and did not have the world-wide extent.

Thereafter, the Ming dynasty unified "China" in the form akin to the idea of the Qin-Han empire, but its Tenka was the synonym of the territory of the Ming dynasty and did not have the world-wide extent.

sen.j: 明末に朱子学に対する批判が起こると、「修身斉家治国平天下」（『大学』）という儒教思想にも変化が起こった。
sen.e: When the criticism against Neo-Confucianism was stirred up in the end of Ming era, there also were changes in the Confucian philosophy of "shushin seika, chikoku, heitenka" (To put the world in order, we must first put the nation in order; to put the nation in order, we must put the family in order; to put the family in order, we must cultivate our personal life) ("Daigaku" (the Great Learning)).

When the criticism against Neo-Confucianism was stirred up in the end of the Ming era, there also were changes in the Confucian philosophy of "修身斉家治国平天下" (in order to put "Tenka" in order, first train one's own moral, then put own family in order, then put the nation in order, and finally bring peace into Tenka) ("Daigaku" [the Great Learning]).
sen.cmt: 「修身斉家治国平天下」は「天下を治めるには、まず自分の行いを正しくし、次に家庭をととのえ、次に国家を治め、そして天下を平和にすべきである」（デジタル大辞泉より）としました。天下に関する文なので、訳はtenkaを採用したほうが良いと思いました。
sen.e: When the criticism against Neo-Confucianism was stirred up in the end of the Ming era, there also were changes in the Confucian philosophy of "修身斉家治国平天下" (in order to put "Tenka" in order, first train one's own moral, then put own family in order, then put the nation in order, and finally bring peace into Tenka) ("Daigaku" [the Great Learning]).

sen.j: 明末清初の王夫之は『大学』のあげる「平天下」はつまるところ国を治めるための思想（すなわち「治国」）を述べるに過ぎず、天下の次元には通用しないものであると述べて、これを尊重する朱子学を批判した。
sen.e: O Fushi, who lived from the end of Ming era to the beginning of Quin era, criticized Neo-Confucianism by arguing that "heitenka" (to put the world in order) described in "Daigaku" was no more than the philosophy of ruling a state (in other word, "chikoku") and it couldn't be applied to the matter of Tenka.

O Fushi, who lived from the end of the Ming era to the beginning of the Quin era, criticized Neo-Confucianism which highly regarded "Daigaku" by arguing that "平天下" (to put "Tenka" in order) described in "Daigaku" was no more than the philosophy of ruling a nation (namely, "治国") and that it could not be applied to the level of Tenka.
sen.cmt: 若干の訳抜けがあるように思われたので補足しました。漢字表記は前文と対応させられるよう、残しました。
sen.e: O Fushi, who lived from the end of the Ming era to the beginning of the Quin era, criticized Neo-Confucianism which highly regarded "Daigaku" by arguing that "平天下" (to put "Tenka" in order) described in "Daigaku" was no more than the philosophy of ruling a nation (namely, "治国") and that it could not be applied to the level of Tenka.

sen.j: 一方明王朝の滅亡により本来的には夷狄であるはずの清王朝が中国を支配するという現実世界での華夷の逆転も「天下」概念に大きく影響した。
sen.e: The Qing Dynasty, which was supposed to be iteki (barbarians), began to rule China after the fall of Ming dynasty, and such reversal in the relation between Chinese and barbarians in the real world also affected the notion of "Tenka".

The Qing Dynasty, which had been originally iteki (barbarians) for China, began to rule China after the fall of the Ming dynasty, and such reversal in the relation between the Chinese and barbarians in the real world also affected the notion of "Tenka."
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくするよう言葉を補いました。
sen.e: The Qing Dynasty, which had been originally iteki (barbarians) for China, began to rule China after the fall of the Ming dynasty, and such reversal in the relation between the Chinese and barbarians in the real world also affected the notion of "Tenka."

sen.j: 同時代の顧炎武は明の滅亡は「亡国」であるが「亡天下」ではなく、夷狄の王朝である清が皇帝となっても、中華の文明が維持される限り天下は継続するものであるという考えを述べた。
sen.e: Ko Enbu of the same era expressed his opinion saying that the fall of Ming is "bokoku" (fall of the state), not "botenka" (fall of Tenka), and Tenka continues to exist, so long as the Chinese cultures are maintained, even the Qing dynasty, a dynasty of iteki, becomes the ruler.

Ko Enbu of the same era expressed his opinion saying that the fall of Ming is "bokoku" (fall of the state), not "botenka" (fall of Tenka), and Tenka continues to exist, so long as the Chinese cultures are maintained, even the Qing dynasty, a dynasty of iteki, becomes the ruler.

Ko Enbu of the same era expressed his opinion saying that the fall of Ming is "bokoku" (fall of the state), not "botenka" (fall of Tenka), and Tenka continues to exist, so long as the Chinese cultures are maintained, even the Qing dynasty, a dynasty of iteki, becomes the ruler.

sen.j: このように「天下」概念に対する検討・批判が加えられたが、このころの「天下」はいまだに中華帝国を中心として捉えられている。
sen.e: As seen in the above, there were a lot of studies/criticism concerning the notion of "Tenka", but "Tenka" was still understood at the time as the one with the Chinese empire in the center.
As seen in the above, there were a lot of studies and criticisms concerning the notion of "Tenka," but at the time "Tenka" was still understood as the one with the Chinese empire in its center.
sen.cmt: Commaの位置を変え、/を外しました。
sen.e: As seen in the above, there were a lot of studies and criticisms concerning the notion of "Tenka," but at the time "Tenka" was still understood as the one with the Chinese empire in its center.

sen.j: 皇帝を中心とする華夷秩序に理念づけられ、朝貢と冊封によって外国との関係を維持していた「天下」概念が変容するのは、1793年イギリスの外交使節ジョージ・マカートニーが派遣されたころからである。
sen.e: The notion of "Tenka", which was based on the order of kai and was supported by the foreign relations of sakuho and choko (bring tributes), started to change when George Macartney, a British diplomat, was dispatched in 1793.

The notion of "Tenka," which had been formed based on the order of kai (the Chinese and barbarians) and maintained the diplomatic relations by the sakuho and choko (bringing tribute) system, started to change when George Macartney, a British diplomat, was dispatched in 1793.
sen.cmt: Commaの位置を変え、言葉を少し補いました。

sen.j: マカートニーは主権平等主義に立つヨーロッパ外交に基づいて清と条約を結ぶことを望んだ。

sen.j: この結果、清朝は従来の華夷秩序に基づいてヨーロッパ諸国と外交することが不可能となり、新たに総理衙門を設けて対ヨーロッパ外交をおこなうこととなった。
sen.e: As a result, it became impossible for China to maintain the diplomatic relations with European countries based on the traditional order of kai, and it established Sorigamon (the office of foreign affairs) in order to deal with the diplomacy with European countries.

sen.e: As a result, it became impossible for China to maintain the diplomatic relations with European countries based on the traditional order of kai (the Chinese vs. barbarians), and it established Sorigamon (the government body in charge of foreign affairs) in order to deal with the diplomacy with European countries.

sen.j: ヨーロッパ諸国が主導して形成した近代外交体制は基本的に主権平等主義に基づき、対等国同士の外交という形式を取っていたため、この外交体制の拡大とともに華夷秩序も徐々に変容あるいは解体されることとなった。
sen.e: Since the modern system of foreign relations that were forged by European countries was based on the principle of sovereign equality, in other words the diplomacy between the independent nations, the order of kai was forced to change or dissolve according to the development of such system of foreign relations.

Since the modern system of foreign relations that had been forged by European countries was based on the principle of sovereign equality, in other words, the diplomacy between independent nations, the order of kai was forced to change or dissolve according to the development of such system of foreign relations.

sen.j: 現実の外交関係においては日清戦争での敗戦によって朝鮮が冊封関係から離脱し、そのことにより冊封と朝貢に基づく清朝の外交秩序は終焉を迎えた。
sen.e: In the real diplomacy, Korea seceded from the relation of sakuho after Qing's defeat in Japanese-Sino War, and the Qing dynasty's diplomacy based on sakuho and choko ended at that time.

sen.e: With the influence of the above, the notion of "Tenka" also changed from the one which was based on the order of kai.

sen.j: 19世紀後半の清の駐英大使であった薛福成は中華と夷狄を区別する「華夷隔絶」の「天下」から中華と外国が対等に関係を維持する「中外連属」の「天下」へと転換したと述べている。
sen.e: Xue Fucheng, Qing's ambassador to the U.K. in the latter half of the 19th century, said that "Tenka" based on "kai kakuzetsu" (distinction between Chinese and barbarians) changed to "Tenka" based on "chugai renzoku" (cooperation between China and foreign countries) under which China and foreign countries maintain the relations on an equal basis.

sen.e: In this case, Tenka basically referred to the territory which was ruled by Ritsuryo Kokka (the Japanese nation under the Ritsuryo codes), namely present Honshu, Shikoku and Kyushu.

sen.e: However, the notion itself included not only the regions which was directly ruled by Ritsuryo kokka but also the regions of different ethnic groups, such as Ezo, which was not directly ruled by Ritsuryo kokka.

sen.e: After the ruling power of Muromachi bakufu declined, public power supporting the notion of Tenka also declined and the society of gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite), a society based on the principle of self-help, appeared.

sen.cmt: 単語と表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: Under such society based on meritocracy, sengoku daimyo (warring lords) established their own territories at various places and formed "kogi"(authorities) equaling the official authority effective only inside their territories.

sen.j: 日本列島の各地に形成されたこのような地域国家的な公儀を天下の公儀として形成しようとしたのが安土桃山時代の特徴である。
sen.e: The characteristics of the Azuchi-Momoyama period was that many sengoku daimyo tried to integrate such kogi, which were formed at various places in Japan as a kind of local states, into the kogi of Tenka.

The characteristics of the Azuchi-Momoyama period was that many sengoku daimyo tried to integrate such kogi, which had been founded at many places throughout Japan as if they were local states, into the kogi of Tenka.
sen.cmt: 少し表現や時制を変えました。
sen.e: The characteristics of the Azuchi-Momoyama period was that many sengoku daimyo tried to integrate such kogi, which had been founded at many places throughout Japan as if they were local states, into the kogi of Tenka.

sen.j: これに伴って、このような新しい秩序を主宰する主体としての統一者として「天下人」概念が登場した。
sen.e: In association with the above, the notion of "Tenkabito" appeared as a person who integrates such local states and presides over the new order.
In association with it, the notion of "Tenkabito" appeared to indicate a person who integrates those locally established authorities and presides over the new order.
sen.cmt: 少し言葉を補い、表現を変えました。
sen.e: In association with it, the notion of "Tenkabito" appeared to indicate a person who integrates those locally established authorities and presides over the new order.

sen.j: このような天下人による「天下一統」（この用語自体は南北朝時代から散見される）によって現実的な「天下」の地理概念はかなり明確化され、ほぼ今日の日本列島と変わらない領域として認識された。
sen.e: Thanks to "Tenka Itto" (unifying Tenka) (this word itself was sometimes used since the Northern and Southern Courts period) by Tenkabito, the geographical notion of "Tenka" was clarified considerably and was understood as the territory corresponding to the present Japanese archipelago.

Thanks to this act of "Tenka Itto" (unifying Tenka) (this word itself was sometimes used since the Northern and Southern Courts period) by Tenkabito, the geographical notion of "Tenka" was clarified considerably and was understood as the territory mostly corresponding to the present Japanese archipelago.
sen.cmt: 少し言葉を補充しました。
sen.e: Thanks to this act of "Tenka Itto" (unifying Tenka) (this word itself was sometimes used since the Northern and Southern Courts period) by Tenkabito, the geographical notion of "Tenka" was clarified considerably and was understood as the territory mostly corresponding to the present Japanese archipelago.

sen.j: (戦国時代 (日本)参照)
sen.e: (refer to the Sengoku period (Japan))
(refer to the Sengoku period [Japan])
(refer to the Sengoku period [Japan])

sen.j: 近世江戸幕府は「天下人＝将軍」、「天下の公儀＝幕府法」と位置づけ、そのもとに「地方的な公儀＝藩法」として大きく二元的な法社会を形成した。
sen.e: Edo bakufu formed the dual legal system by defining "Tenkabito = shogun", "kogi of Tenka = law of bakufu" and placing "local kogi = law of domain" under them.

The Edo bakufu formed the broadly-defined dual legal system which had "Tenkabito = shogun" and "the kogi of Tenka = the law of the bakufu" on top and "the local kogi = the law of domains" at the bottom.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: The Edo bakufu formed the broadly-defined dual legal system which had "Tenkabito = shogun" and "the kogi of Tenka = the law of the bakufu" on top and "the local kogi = the law of domains" at the bottom.

sen.j: このようにして成立した幕藩体制国家は、対外関係を華夷秩序に擬制して編成し、具体的には海禁政策（鎖国）をとった。
sen.e: The nation of shogunate system built up its foreign relations by imitating the order of kai and adopted kaikin policy (national isolation).
The nation of the shogunate system which had been built up this way created its foreign relations by imitating the order of kai and adopted the kaikin policy (national isolation) in practice.
sen.cmt: 訳残しがあるように思えたので、補充しました。
sen.e: The nation of the shogunate system which had been built up this way created its foreign relations by imitating the order of kai and adopted the kaikin policy (national isolation) in practice.

sen.j: このことは日本における「天下」概念をますます固有の地理概念である日本列島に近づけたと考えられる。
sen.e: This made the notion of "Tenka" in Japan more closer to the geographical notion, namely Japanese archipelago.
This made the notion of "Tenka" in Japan more closer to the geographical notion, namely the Japanese archipelago.

sen.j: 朝鮮における「天下」
sen.e: Tenka in Korea
Tenka in Korea
Tenka in Korea

sen.j: 朝鮮における「天下」概念はまず高句麗において成立した。
sen.e: The notion of "Tenka" in Korea was established in Goguryeo for the first time.
The notion of "Tenka" in Korea was established in Goguryeo for the first time.
The notion of "Tenka" in Korea was established in Goguryeo for the first time.

sen.j: 高句麗は自国を中華とし、周辺諸民族を夷狄視する小中華的天下観を持っていた。
sen.e: Goguryeo had a view of Tenka, something like mini-Sinocentrism, which deemed Goguryeo as chuka (the center of the world) and other ethnic groups as barbarians.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Goguryeo deemed itself as chuka (China) and held a view of Tenka akin to mini-Sinocentrism, in which it regarded surrounding other ethnic groups as barbarians.
sen.cmt: 分かりづらい表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Goguryeo deemed itself as chuka (China) and held a view of Tenka akin to mini-Sinocentrism, in which it regarded surrounding other ethnic groups as barbarians.

sen.j: それは同時に天や河に対する独自の信仰形式を内包していた。
sen.e: At the same time, this world view also involved the unique religion for Ten and river.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, this view also involved its unique religious belief toward the sky and rivers.
sen.cmt: 言葉を少し補いました。
sen.e: At the same time, this view also involved its unique religious belief toward the sky and rivers.

sen.j: 広開土王碑には「永楽」という独自の年号が記載されている。
sen.e: The unique name of an era "Eiraku" was inscribed on Gwanggaeto Stele.
The name of an era "Eiraku" unique to Korea was inscribed on Gwanggaeto Stele.
The name of an era "Eiraku" unique to Korea was inscribed on Gwanggaeto Stele.

sen.j: 百済・新羅もそれぞれ独自の「天下」概念を有していたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that Baekje and Silla had their own notion of "Tenka" respectively.
It is thought that Baekje and Silla also had their own notion of "Tenka."
It is thought that Baekje and Silla also had their own notion of "Tenka."

sen.j: 一方で中国思想の影響の下に周の封建国としての箕子朝鮮神話が形成されており、儒教の教えが古くからこの地に根付いていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, Gishi-chosen mythology was created under the influence of Chinese philosophy and the teachings of Confucius took root here from long ago.

On the other hand, the mythology of Gija Joseon (allegedly, one of the ancient Korean dynasties) as a nation feudatory to the Zhou dynasty was created under the influence of Chinese philosophy, and the teachings of Confucius had taken root here since a long time ago.
sen.cmt: 「箕子朝鮮」をGija Joseonとし、説明を補足しました。訳漏れ部を補いました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the mythology of Gija Joseon (allegedly, one of the ancient Korean dynasties) as a nation feudatory to the Zhou dynasty was created under the influence of Chinese philosophy, and the teachings of Confucius had taken root here since a long time ago.

sen.j: このことは中国の天下概念の中に朝鮮を位置づけようとする傾向を持っていた。
sen.e: Due to the above, Korea tended to be put inside the Chinese notion of "Tenka".
Due to the above, Korea tended to be put inside the Chinese notion of "Tenka".
Due to the above, Korea tended to be put inside the Chinese notion of "Tenka".

sen.j: 高麗時代には仏教・道教・シャーマニズムをよりどころとしながらも、朝鮮独自の天下概念を展開する壇君神話が成立した。
sen.e: During the era of Goryeo, Dankun mythology, which was based on Buddhism/Taoism/shamanism and described the Korean notion of "Tenka", was created.

During the era of Goryeo, the mythology of Dankun (a legendary state of ancient Korea), which described the Korean notion of "Tenka" although it was based on Buddhism, Taoism and shamanism, was created.
sen.cmt: /を外しました。「壇君」の説明を補いました。
sen.e: During the era of Goryeo, the mythology of Dankun (a legendary state of ancient Korea), which described the Korean notion of "Tenka" although it was based on Buddhism, Taoism and shamanism, was created.

sen.j: 新羅は唐の太宗に国内で独自の年号を用いていることを咎められて以降唐の正朔を守っていたが、高麗前期には中国王朝の年号と高麗独自の年号を交互に使用していた。
sen.e: Silla had observed Tang's seisaku (calendar) since it was charged by Taiso for using its own era name, but the era name of Chinese dynasty and Goryeo's own era name was alternately used during the first half of Goryeo era.

Silla observed Tang's seisaku (calendar) since it was charged with the use of its own era name by Taizong (the second emperor) of the Tang dynasty, but during the first half of Goryeo era, the era name of the Chinese dynasty and that of Goryeo's own were alternately used.
sen.cmt: 太宗をTaizongとし、説明を補いました。
sen.e: Silla observed Tang's seisaku (calendar) since it was charged with the use of its own era name by Taizong (the second emperor) of the Tang dynasty, but during the first half of Goryeo era, the era name of the Chinese dynasty and that of Goryeo's own were alternately used.

sen.j: 国内では王は「朕」と自称し、死後は廟号を贈られ、王の命令を「制」「詔」などと記していた。
sen.e: Inside the nation, a king called himself "chin", he was given byogo (a name given to a dead emperor for the ceremony of putting the soul in a mausoleum) and the king's order was written as "sei" (制) or sho (詔).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A king called himself "chin" inside the nation and was given a byogo (a name given to a dead emperor for the ceremony of putting the soul in a mausoleum), and his order was written as "sei" (制) or sho (詔).
sen.cmt: 言葉の重複を避けました。
sen.e: A king called himself "chin" inside the nation and was given a byogo (a name given to a dead emperor for the ceremony of putting the soul in a mausoleum), and his order was written as "sei" (制) or sho (詔).

sen.j: これは中国の華夷思想によると中国王朝の皇帝にしか許されないことであった。
sen.e: According to the Chinese philosophy of kai, however, these were only allowed for the emperor of Chinese dynasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the Chinese philosophy of kai, however, these were only allowed for the emperors of the Chinese dynasty.

sen.j: さらに当時の宮廷の頌歌では「海東天子」や「南蛮北狄自ら来朝す」といった表現があり、当時の金石文には「皇帝陛下詔して曰く」と刻しているものもある。
sen.e: Further, the phrase "海東天子" and "南蛮北狄自ら来朝す" are seen in the songs of the Court at that time, and the inscription of "皇帝陛下詔して曰く" is seen on kinsekibun (words written on metal and stones).
sen.cmt: 「海東天子」、「南蛮北狄自ら来朝す」、「皇帝陛下詔して曰く」→読み、定訳不明

sen.j: 天子の特権である皇帝祭祀も行われ、都であった開城は「皇都」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: A religious service for the emperor, which was the privilege of tenshi (emperor), was conducted, and Kaijo, the capital, was called "Koto" (literally, emperor's capital).
A religious service for the emperor, which was the privilege of tenshi (emperor), was conducted, and Kaijo, the capital, was called "Koto" (literally, emperor's capital).

sen.j: 一方高麗時代の中国的「天下」概念では、中国内部に宋・遼、宋・金が並び立つ情勢のなか、宋を南朝、遼・金を北朝として両属する形を維持していた。
sen.e: Under the Chinese notion of "Tenka" during the era of Goryeo, Sung was called the Southern Court and Liao or Jing was called the Northern Court since Sung and Liao or Sung and Jin co-existed in China.

Under the Chinese notion of "Tenka" during the era of Goryeo, Sung was called the Southern Court and Liao or Jing was called the Northern Court since Sung and Liao or Sung and Jin co-existed in China.

Under the Chinese notion of "Tenka" during the era of Goryeo, Sung was called the Southern Court and Liao or Jing was called the Northern Court since Sung and Liao or Sung and Jin co-existed in China.

sen.j: しかし、理念上は南朝を重視する傾向にあり、両朝の年号を併記する場合は南朝を先とすることが一般的であった。
sen.e: Goryeo tended to regard the Southern Court as important and put the era name of Southern Court first when the both era names were written together.

sen.j: そのため、宋によりその忠実さを「小中華」と称えられた。
sen.e: As a result, it was praised by Sung as "sho-chuka" for its loyalty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, it was praised by Sung as "sho-chuka" for its loyalty.

sen.j: 中国に元王朝が成立すると、元は高麗に従来以上の服属を要求し、朕という自称や廟号、制・詔といった用語も廃された。
sen.e: After the establishment of Yuan dynasty, it requested Goryeo to obey further than before, and the use of the terms "chin", "byogo" and "sei/sho" was abolished.

sen.cmt: 文法など若干修正しました。
sen.e: After the Yuan dynasty was established, it requested Goryeo to obey further than before, and the use of the terms "chin," "byogo," and "sei and sho" was abolished.

sen.j: 高麗国王は自称を「不穀」（穀は善の意で、不穀とは不善という意味で謙った自称）と改めた。
sen.e: The king of Goryeo began to call himself "fukoku (it is a humble way of calling himself since koku means good and fukoku means not good).

sen.j: またこのころ朱子学が流入し、名分論が盛んとなった。
sen.e: Neo-Confucianism was introduced around that time and meibunron became popular.
Neo-Confucianism was introduced around that time and meibunron became popular.

sen.j: 李氏朝鮮の時代には、明の冊封を受け国号を「朝鮮」としたこともあって、「明＝李氏朝鮮」関係を「周＝箕子朝鮮」関係と同一視する中華的な「天下」概念があった。
sen.e: During the era of Joseon Dynasty, the state name was changed to "Chosen" since it entered into sakuho relation with Ming, and there was a Chinese-style notion of "Tenka" under which the relation of "Ming = Joseon Dynasty" was deemed as identical to the relation of "Zhou = Gishi-chosen".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the era of the Joseon Dynasty, the state name was changed to "Chosen" since it entered into the sakuho relation with Ming, and there was a Chinese-style notion of "Tenka" under which the relation of "Ming between the Joseon Dynasty" was deemed as identical to the relation of "Zhou between Gija Joseon."
sen.cmt: 李氏朝鮮をGija Joseonとしました。ここでの=はイコールの意味ではないと思うので、使用を避けました。
sen.e: During the era of the Joseon Dynasty, the state name was changed to "Chosen" since it entered into the sakuho relation with Ming, and there was a Chinese-style notion of "Tenka" under which the relation of "Ming between the Joseon Dynasty" was deemed as identical to the relation of "Zhou between Gija Joseon."

sen.j: 世宗 (朝鮮王)時代には女真・日本・対馬・壱岐・松浦・琉球などを自国に朝貢する対象と主観する「天下」概念も存在し、祀天もおこなわれた。
sen.e: During the era of Sejong (king of Korea), there was a notion of "Tenka" under which Jurchen, Japan, Tsushima, Iki, Matsuura and Ryukyu were deemed as tributary nations, and shiten was also conducted.
sen.cmt: 祀天→定訳不明 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the reign of Sejong (the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty), there was a notion of "Tenka" under which Jurchen, Japan, Tsushima, Iki, Matsuura and Ryukyu were deemed as tributary nations, and shiten was also conducted.
sen.cmt: 世宗は王名なので、reignを使いました。説明も補足しました。「祀天」の定訳が不明です。
sen.e: During the reign of Sejong (the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty), there was a notion of "Tenka" under which Jurchen, Japan, Tsushima, Iki, Matsuura and Ryukyu were deemed as tributary nations, and shiten was also conducted.

sen.j: また明では陽明学が流行していたが、朝鮮ではこれを儒教の堕落とみる風潮があった。
sen.e: Although Yomei-gaku (neo-Confucianism based on teaching of Wang Yangming) was popular in Ming, there was a tendency in Korea to regard it as the corruption of Confucianism.

sen.j: 清の時代には冊封を受け、服属しながらも知識人の間では明の崇禎年号が好んで使用された。
sen.e: Korea received sakuho during the era of Qing dynasty, but the era name of Ming dynasty was favored by intellectuals.
Korea received sakuho (the title, etc. given in return to tribute to China) during the era of the Qing dynasty, but the era name of the Ming dynasty was favored by intellectuals.

sen.e: Korea received sakuho (the title, etc. given in return to tribute to China) during the era of the Qing dynasty, but the era name of the Ming dynasty was favored by intellectuals.

sen.j: これは中国が清という夷狄の王朝に支配されているため、朝鮮こそが中華の本流であるという意識に基づいている。
sen.e: The above derived from the perception that Korea was the mainstream of chuka since China was ruled by Qing, a dynasty of iteki (barbarians).

sen.j: ヴェトナムにおける「天下」
sen.e: "Tenka" in Vietnam
"Tenka" in Vietnam
"Tenka" in Vietnam

sen.j: 前述したように、ヴェトナムにおける「天下」概念の成立は13世紀にモンゴル軍撃退後の国威発揚に伴って顕著に確認される。
sen.e: As mentioned earlier, the notion of Tenka" was established in Vietnam when it repelled the army of Mongolia in the 13th century.
As mentioned earlier, the notion of Tenka" was established in Vietnam when it repelled the army of Mongolia in the 13th century.
As mentioned earlier, the notion of Tenka" was established in Vietnam when it repelled the army of Mongolia in the 13th century.

sen.j: 陳朝で成立した『大越史記』においては、秦漢時代に今日の広東からヴェトナム北部に存在した南越国をヴェトナム最初の正統王朝とし、この地域を対象とする「天下」概念が形成された。
sen.e: According to "Daietsu shiki" written in the era of Trần dynasty, Nanetsukoku, a nation located in the region ranging from present Canton to North Vietnam, was the first legitimate dynasty of Vietnam, and the notion of "Tenka" which referred to this region was created.

According to "Daietsu shiki" written in the era of Trần dynasty, Nanetsukoku, a nation located in the region ranging from present Canton to North Vietnam, was the first legitimate dynasty of Vietnam, and the notion of "Tenka" which referred to this region was created.

According to "Daietsu shiki" written in the era of Trần dynasty, Nanetsukoku, a nation located in the region ranging from present Canton to North Vietnam, was the first legitimate dynasty of Vietnam, and the notion of "Tenka" which referred to this region was created.

sen.j: この「天下」概念の実例としては、1428年に大越が明から独立した際、この時代を代表する文人であるグエン・チャイが「自趙丁李陳之肇造、我国与漢唐宋元而各帝一方」（趙佗の南越国・丁部領の丁朝・李朝 (ベトナム)・陳朝以来、我が国は中国の漢・唐・宋・元などの王朝と同じく帝を称して天下の一方に君臨してきた）と述べていることがあげられる。
sen.e: An example of this notion of "Tenka" was the remark, which was made by Guen Chai, a man of literature representing this era, in 1428 when Daietsu became independent from Ming, saying"Since the era of Tei dynasty, Yi Dynasty (Vietnam) and Trần Dynasty, Nanetsukoku has been standing as with Hang/Tang/Sung/Yuan dynasty in China"

An example of this notion of "Tenka" was the remark made by Guen Chai, a man of literature representing this era, in 1428 when Daietsu (Đại Việt) became independent from Ming, saying "Since the era of Nanetsukoku (the kingdom of Nanyue) founded by Zhao Tuo, the Đinh dynasty founded by Đinh Bộ Lĩnh, the Lý Dynasty (Vietnam) and the Trần Dynasty, my country had reigned over part of "Tenka" as with the Hang, Tang, Sung or Yuan dynasty in China."
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ部を補いました。
sen.e: An example of this notion of "Tenka" was the remark made by Guen Chai, a man of literature representing this era, in 1428 when Daietsu (Đại Việt) became independent from Ming, saying "Since the era of Nanetsukoku (the kingdom of Nanyue) founded by Zhao Tuo, the Đinh dynasty founded by Đinh Bộ Lĩnh, the Lý Dynasty (Vietnam) and the Trần Dynasty, my country had reigned over part of "Tenka" as with the Hang, Tang, Sung or Yuan dynasty in China."

sen.j: ここに明らかなように、ヴェトナムの「天下」は中国の「天下」と同列なものとして主観されている。
sen.e: As shown by the above, "Tenka" of Vietnam was regarded on a par with "Tenka" of China.
As shown by the above, "Tenka" of Vietnam was regarded on a par with "Tenka" of China.
As shown by the above, "Tenka" of Vietnam was regarded on a par with "Tenka" of China.

sen.j: このような「天下」概念の下では、従来の仏教・道教の神々にかわり、ヴェトナム土着の神々が尊重され、対外戦争に勝利するたびヴェトナムの土着神に対して加封（神々に対し新たに称号を加えること）がなされた。
sen.e: Under such notion of "Tenka", native Vietnamese deities came to be respected in place of traditional deities of Buddhism/Taoism, and kaho (to give a new title to deities) was made for native Vietnamese deities whenever the nation achieved a victory in foreign wars.

Under such notion of "Tenka," native Vietnamese deities came to be respected in place of traditional deities of Buddhism or Taoism, and kaho (to give a new title to deities) was made to them whenever the nation achieved a victory in foreign wars.
sen.cmt: Commaの位置を変え、また重複表現を避けました。
sen.e: Under such notion of "Tenka," native Vietnamese deities came to be respected in place of traditional deities of Buddhism or Taoism, and kaho (to give a new title to deities) was made to them whenever the nation achieved a victory in foreign wars.

sen.j: このことはヴェトナムの「天下」概念において、皇帝はヴェトナム土着の神々より上位に位置していることとともに、民族固有の信仰がこのような「天下」概念を側面から支えていたことを示している。
sen.e: The above shows the fact that under the Vietnamese notion of "Tenka", the emperor was placed higher than native Vietnamese deities and the ethnic belief indirectly supported such notion of "Tenka".
The above shows that under the Vietnamese notion of "Tenka," the emperor was placed higher than native Vietnamese deities and the ethnic belief indirectly supported such notion of "Tenka."

sen.j: 15世紀末頃からこのような「天下」概念に若干の変化が起こった。
sen.e: Such notion of "Tenka" began to change slightly from the end of the 15th century.
This notion began to change slightly from the end of the 15th century.
sen.cmt: 語の重複を避けました。
sen.e: This notion began to change slightly from the end of the 15th century.

sen.j: ヴェトナムの正史において南越国が徐々に本紀から外され、ヴェトナム独自の神話や伝承に基づく涇陽王・貉龍君・雄王などが正史における地位を向上させた。
sen.e: Nanetsukoku was gradually removed from the official history of Vietnam, and the status of 涇陽王, 貉龍君 and 雄王 was raised based on the Vietnam's own mythology and oral tradition.
sen.cmt: 涇陽王、貉龍君、雄王→読み不明
sen.e: Nanetsukoku was gradually removed from the official history of Vietnam, and the status of 涇陽王, 貉龍君 (names of Vietnamese legendary kings) and 雄王 (the title of a line of kings of Văn Lang, an ancient Vietnamese nation) was raised instead based on the Vietnam's own mythology and oral tradition.
sen.cmt: 涇陽王, 貉龍君 and 雄王の説明を補いました。
sen.e: Nanetsukoku was gradually removed from the official history of Vietnam, and the status of 涇陽王, 貉龍君 (names of Vietnamese legendary kings) and 雄王 (the title of a line of kings of Văn Lang, an ancient Vietnamese nation) was raised instead based on the Vietnam's own mythology and oral tradition.

sen.j: それとともに中国領内にある嶺南地方をヴェトナムと一体として考える思想が衰退し、18世紀末には正史において南越国は正統から外された。
sen.e: In association with the above, the philosophy which regards China's Reinan region as a part of Vietnam declined and Nanetsukoku finally lost its legitimacy in the official history book written at the end of 18th century.

In association with it, the idea of regarding China's Lingnan region as a part of Vietnam declined, and Nanetsukoku finally lost its legitimacy in the official history book at the end of 18th century.
sen.cmt: 単語と表現を少し変えました。
sen.e: In association with it, the idea of regarding China's Lingnan region as a part of Vietnam declined, and Nanetsukoku finally lost its legitimacy in the official history book at the end of 18th century.

sen.j: このころ現実のヴェトナムは黎朝の名目的皇帝のもとに北に「トンキン」と呼ばれた鄭氏政権、南に「コーチシナ」と呼ばれた阮氏政権が実質的に支配を二分している状況にあった。
sen.e: Around that time, Vietnam had a nominal emperor of Lê dynasty, but the nation was divided into two since the administration of Trinh clan, which was called "Tonkin, ruled the northern part in effect and the administration of Nguyễn clan, which was called "Cochinchine", ruled the southern part in effect.

Around that time, Vietnam was practically divided into two administrations, the Trinh clan administration called "Tonkin" in the north and the Nguyễn clan administration called "Cochinchine" in the south, under a nominal emperor of the Lê dynasty.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: Around that time, Vietnam was practically divided into two administrations, the Trinh clan administration called "Tonkin" in the north and the Nguyễn clan administration called "Cochinchine" in the south, under a nominal emperor of the Lê dynasty.

sen.j: このころの「天下」は黎朝の皇帝の下に成立しているトンキン・コーチシナを中心とした世界であったと考えられている。
sen.e: "Tenka" at the time is thought as the world consisted of Tonkin/Cochinchine under the emperor of Lê dynasty.
"Tenka" at the time is thought to have been the world which consisted of Tonkin and Cochinchine under the emperor of the Lê dynasty.
"Tenka" at the time is thought to have been the world which consisted of Tonkin and Cochinchine under the emperor of the Lê dynasty.

sen.j: 19世紀に成立した阮朝では、中国向けには「越南」を名乗りながらも自称国号においては「大南」を称し、中華世界とは区別された独自の領域としてのヴェトナム世界が規定されるに至った。
sen.e: Nguyễn Dynasty, which was established in the 19th century, used the nation name of "Etsunan" to China while calling itself "Dainan", and the notion of Vietnam's own world, which was distinguished from that of China, was defined.

The Nguyễn dynasty, which was established in the 19th century, used the nation name of "Etsunan" to China while calling itself "Đại Nam," and the notion of Vietnam's own world, which was distinguished from that of China, was defined.
sen.cmt: 大南を"Đại Nam"とし、他commaの位置など変更しました。
sen.e: The Nguyễn dynasty, which was established in the 19th century, used the nation name of "Etsunan" to China while calling itself "Đại Nam," and the notion of Vietnam's own world, which was distinguished from that of China, was defined.

sen.j: 北方アジアの遊牧民における「天下」
sen.e: "Tenka" among the nomades in North Asia

sen.j: アジアの遊牧民における天下に類似する概念の歴史は、匈奴の時代にまで遡ることができる。
sen.e: The history of the notion which resembles to Tenka among the nomades in North Asia dates back to the era of Xiongnu.
The history of the notion corresponding to Tenka among the nomads in North Asia dates back to the era of Xiongnu.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: The history of the notion corresponding to Tenka among the nomads in North Asia dates back to the era of Xiongnu.

sen.j: 「天」にあたる概念としては「テングリ」という言葉が知られ、中国側の史料に「撐犂」と音写されている。
sen.e: The word "Tenguri" is known as the one that corresponds to "Ten", and it was transcribed in Chinese historical material as "撐犂".
The word "Tenguri" is known as the notion which corresponds to "Ten," and it was transcribed in Chinese historical materials as "撐犂."
sen.cmt: Commaの位置を変え、若干表現を変えました。
sen.e: The word "Tenguri" is known as the notion which corresponds to "Ten," and it was transcribed in Chinese historical materials as "撐犂."

sen.j: 匈奴の君主である単于は「天降単于（テングリから降りてきた単于）」「天所立匈奴大単于（テングリによって立つ大単于）」と中国側の史料で表現されている。
sen.e: Zenu, the head of Xiongnu, is explained in Chinese historical material as "Zenu who descended from Tenguri" or "Great Zenu who is supported by Tenguri".
Chanyu, the head of Xiongnu, is explained in Chinese historical materials as "the chanyu who descended from Tenguri" or "Great Chanyu who is supported by Tenguri".
Chanyu, the head of Xiongnu, is explained in Chinese historical materials as "the chanyu who descended from Tenguri" or "Great Chanyu who is supported by Tenguri".

sen.j: ここに明らかなように、テングリは天界であるとともに、天神として人格神を指すこともある。
sen.e: As shown by the above, while Tenguri refers to Tenkai (the heavens), it sometimes refers to a humanized god as Tenjin (heavenly gods).
As shown by the above, while Tenguri refers to Tenkai (the heavens), it sometimes refers to a humanized god as Tenjin (heavenly gods).

sen.j: これは中国における「天」概念と非常に類似しており、両者の関連性がしばしば指摘されているが、どちらのほうが起源として古いかは明らかにされていない。
sen.e: The above is quite similar to the notion of "Ten" in China and their relevancy is often pointed out, but it is unknown which is older in terms of origin.

sen.cmt: the aboveの重複を避けました。

sen.j: この「テングリ」概念はウイグルなどのトルコ系遊牧民やモンゴル系遊牧民にも共通しており、一貫して二面的に使用されている。
sen.e: The above notion of "Tenguri", which has two aspects, is commonly seen among the nomads in Turkey and those in Mongolia.
This notion of "Tenguri" which bears two aspects is commonly seen among the nomads in Turkey and those in Mongolia.
sen.cmt: Commaの位置を変え、不要な半角スペースを除きました。
sen.e: This notion of "Tenguri" which bears two aspects is commonly seen among the nomads in Turkey and those in Mongolia.

sen.j: また人格神としての「テングリ」はモンゴルの宇宙創造神話において「テングリ・ハイラハン」という地上を作った創造神として現れる。
sen.e: "Tenguri" as a humanized god appears in the Mongolian mythology of universe creation as "Tenguri Hairahan", a god who created the earth.

sen.j: モンゴル帝国の時代には歴代大ハーンの外交文書のなかで、テングリの名の下に地上の支配を託された者として大ハーンを位置づける声明が確認される。
sen.e: In the diplomatic documents issued by successive great khans during the era of the Mongolian Empire, a great khan is defined as the person who was entruted the rule of earth by Tenguri.
In the diplomatic documents issued by successive great khans during the era of the Mongolian Empire, a great khan is defined as the person who was entrusted the rule of the earth by Tenguri.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを直しました。
sen.e: In the diplomatic documents issued by successive great khans during the era of the Mongolian Empire, a great khan is defined as the person who was entrusted the rule of the earth by Tenguri.

sen.j: 「耳の聞きうる限りの土地、馬でたどりつきうる限りの土地」「日出ずるところより日没するところまで」大ハーンの支配に服することが表明されており、そこには基本的に地理的限定はない。
sen.e: It is clearly expressed that "the land which can be heard by ears or the land which can be reached by a horse" or "the land ranging from the place where the sun rises to the place where the sun sets" should be under the rule of great khan, and there is no geographical limit.

It is clearly expressed that "the land which can be heard by ears or the land which can be reached by a horse" or "the land ranging from the place where the sun rises to the place where the sun sets" should be under the rule of the great khan, and basically there is no geographical limit.

sen.j: 最近の研究ではそもそもモンゴル帝国の国号としての「モンゴル・ウルス」そのものが本来的に「モンゴルの人々の集合体」というような意味合いで、地理的概念を含むものではないと指摘されている。
sen.e: According to the recent research, it is pointed out that "Mongolia ulus", the name of Mongolian Empire, had the meaning of "the aggregation of Mongolian people" and it didn't include geographical notion.

According to the recent research, it is pointed out that "Mongol Ulus," the name of the Mongolian Empire, had the meaning of "the aggregation of Mongolian people" and did not include a geographical notion.

sen.e: According to the recent research, it is pointed out that "Mongol Ulus," the name of the Mongolian Empire, had the meaning of "the aggregation of Mongolian people" and did not include a geographical notion.

sen.j: アジアの遊牧民の地上世界観にも、一定の秩序原理に基づき地理的限定を含まないという意味で「天下」概念と類似した構造を見ることができる。
sen.e: A similarity to the notion of "Tenka", which is based on the fixed principle of order and doesn't include geographical notion, is seen in the world view of Asian nomads.
A similarity to the notion of "Tenka" that it is formed based on the fixed principle of order and does not include geographical notion is seen in the world view of the Asian nomads.

sen.j: また遊牧民の世界観の開放的な性質も指摘されている。
sen.e: Open nature of the world view of nomads is also pointed out.

sen.j: それは元朝治下に製作された原図を基にしていると思われる『混一疆理歴代国都之図』によく表されている。

sen.j: 「混一」という言葉はモンゴル帝国時代に用いられ始めた用語であることが指摘されているが、その意味は当時知られていた世界としてのアフリカ大陸・ユーラシア大陸が境界なく渾然一体となっているという世界観を表しているという。
sen.e: The term "混一", which is said to have come into use in the age of Mongolian empire, means the view of the world believing that the African continent and the Eurasian continent form a harmonious whole with no border.

sen.j: これは中国的な華夷を区別する世界観とは異なり、非常に開かれたものであった。
sen.e: Compared with Chinese view of the world which distinguish ka from i, this world view is very open.
Compared with the Chinese view of the world which distinguish "ka" (the Chinese) from "i" (barbarians), this world view is very open.

sen.e: Compared with the Chinese view of the world which distinguish "ka" (the Chinese) from "i" (barbarians), this world view is very open.

sen.j: 同様にイランのイル・ハン国で編集された『集史』においては、世界中の歴史資料を総合し編纂し直して、世界の歴史像としての「世界史」を編もうという意図が看取されている。
sen.e: In "Shushi" which was compiled in Iruhankoku in Iran, the intention is seen to compile a "world history" by integrating the world-wide historical material.

Similarly, in "Shushi" (an Iranian work of literature and history) which was compiled in Ilkhanate in Iran, the intention is seen to compile "the world history" by integrating the world-wide historical materials.
sen.cmt: イル・ハン国をIlkhanateとしました。他、集史の説明も補いました。
sen.e: Similarly, in "Shushi" (an Iranian work of literature and history) which was compiled in Ilkhanate in Iran, the intention is seen to compile "the world history" by integrating the world-wide historical materials.

sen.j: モンゴル帝国にいずれは組み込まれる歴史であるという意味でモンゴル帝国中心ではあるけれども、主要地域の歴史をそれぞれ自立した形で並列的に扱っており、同時代までの中国歴代王朝の正史やヨーロッパ側の歴史書とは大きく異なっている。
sen.e: Though it was compiled with the Mongolian Empire in the center on the premise that all regions would be incorporated into the Mongolian Empire, it is quite different from the official history of Chinese dynasties or history books written in Europe in the sense that it treated the history of major regions independently as well as in parallel.

Although it was compiled with the Mongolian Empire in the center on the premise that all regions would be incorporated into the Mongolian Empire in future, it is quite different from the official history of Chinese dynasties or history books written in Europe in the sense that it treated the history of major regions independently as well as in parallel.

Although it was compiled with the Mongolian Empire in the center on the premise that all regions would be incorporated into the Mongolian Empire in future, it is quite different from the official history of Chinese dynasties or history books written in Europe in the sense that it treated the history of major regions independently as well as in parallel.
